org.ObjectLayout

Class PrimitiveCharArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ObjectLayout.AbstractPrimitiveArray
      • org.ObjectLayout.PrimitiveCharArray

  • public class PrimitiveCharArray
extends AbstractPrimitiveArray
    A subclassable array of chars. PrimitiveCharArray is designed with semantics specifically chosen and restricted such that a "flat" memory layout of the implemented data structure would be possible on optimizing JVMs. While fully functional on all JVM implementation (of Java SE 6 and above), the semantics are such that a JVM may transparently optimise the implementation to provide a compact contiguous layout that facilitates dead-reckoning (as opposed to de-referenced) access to elements

        public char[] asArray()
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Get a reference to a char[] that represents the contents of this array. Will throw an exception if array is too long to represent as a char[].

        Throws:

      • copyInstance

        public static <A extends PrimitiveCharArray> A copyInstance(A source)
                                                 throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        Create a new <A extends PrimitiveCharArray> instance, using a copy constructor to replicate the contents of the given source array

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if <A> does not have a copy constructor
